workflow_rationale: This is a feature enhancement that extends existing version control capabilities with visual diff comparison, comprehensive content type support, and granular rollback controls. It builds upon the existing pageVersions infrastructure while adding significant new functionality across backend, storage, and frontend layers.

phases.name: Package Verification & Installation
phases.description: Verify and install required npm packages for compression and diff functionality before implementation

subtasks.description: Research and verify compression library (pako) compatibility

verification.instructions: Verify pako package exists on npm, check API documentation, confirm React 19 compatibility

subtasks.notes: Verified pako@2.1.0 on npm. MIT+Zlib license, zero dependencies, ESM support. TypeScript types available via @types/pako@2.0.4. API: pako.deflate()/inflate() for sync, Deflate/Inflate classes for streaming. React 19 compatible (no React dependency). Performance: ~10 ops/sec deflate, ~130 ops/sec inflate on 1MB. Perfect for JSON/HTML/text compression.

subtasks.description: Research and verify diff library (diff-match-patch or alternative)

verification.instructions: Verify diff library exists, check API for text diffing, confirm React 19 compatibility and bundle size impact

subtasks.notes: Verified `diff` package (jsdiff) v7.x as the recommended diff library. Key findings: (1) Already a transitive dependency in project (v4.0.2 via jest-diff) confirming compatibility, (2) Zero dependencies, pure JavaScript - fully React 19 compatible, (3) Built-in TypeScript types since v5.x, (4) Rich API: diffChars(), diffWords(), diffLines(), diffSentences() for flexible document comparison, (5) createPatch()/applyPatch() for generating/applying unified diffs, (6) ~40KB minified, ~12KB gzipped - acceptable bundle size, (7) BSD-3-Clause license compatible with project's AGPL-3.0. Alternative diff-match-patch considered but `diff` preferred for: simpler API, built-in types, more active maintenance, already proven in dependency tree.

subtasks.description: Research and verify React diff viewer component

verification.instructions: Verify react-diff-view or similar component, check React 19 compatibility, assess bundle size

subtasks.notes: Verified react-diff-viewer-continued@4.0.6 as the recommended React diff viewer component. Key findings: (1) Explicitly supports React 19 in peerDependencies (^19.0.0), (2) Small bundle size: 27.7KB minified, 9.3KB gzipped, (3) Uses same `diff` package we're using for backend consistency, (4) Built-in TypeScript types with ESM + CJS support, (5) MIT license compatible with project, (6) Updated May 2025 with active maintenance, (7) Uses @emotion/css for styling (compatible with Tailwind), (8) Simple API for text/content diffing - works with plain strings. Alternative react-diff-view@3.3.2 rejected due to: larger bundle (23.6KB gzipped), designed for git unified diff format (adds complexity), uses lodash (heavier), no explicit React 19 support in peerDependencies.

verification.command: pnpm install && pnpm list pako diff-match-patch

subtasks.notes: Successfully added pako@^2.1.0, diff-match-patch@^1.0.5, @types/pako@^2.0.3, and @types/diff-match-patch@^1.0.36 to packages/lib/package.json. Committed as fb582b7.

phases.name: Storage Layer - Compression
phases.description: Add compression support to page content storage for efficient version storage

subtasks.notes: Created compression utilities module at packages/lib/src/utils/compression.ts with: compress(), decompress(), shouldCompress(), compressIfNeeded(), decompressIfNeeded(). Uses pako library with zlib deflate at maximum compression level (9). Returns metadata including originalSize, compressedSize, compressionRatio. Handles unicode, special characters, and includes comprehensive error handling. Test file created at packages/lib/src/__tests__/compression.test.ts with 40+ test cases covering round-trip integrity, large documents, edge cases, and error handling. Committed as efa7e3b. Note: Tests need to be run manually (pnpm test -- compression.test.ts) as package manager commands were restricted in this environment.

verification.expected: Content store tests pass with compression

subtasks.notes: Extended page-content-store with compression support. Added WritePageContentOptions (compress: 'auto' | true | false) and WritePageContentResult with compression metadata (ref, size, compressed, storedSize, compressionRatio). Uses magic header 'PSCOMP\0' for detecting compressed content. readPageContent() auto-decompresses transparently. New helper functions: isContentCompressed(), getContentMetadata(). Created comprehensive test suite at packages/lib/src/__tests__/page-content-store.test.ts. Backward compatible - existing code destructuring {ref, size} continues to work. Committed as df30762.

Updated page-version-service to use compression from page-content-store. Changes: (1) Added CompressionMetadata interface for JSONB storage, (2) Added CreatePageVersionResult interface with compression fields, (3) Updated createPageVersion() to capture compression metadata from writePageContent() result, (4) Compression metadata stored in metadata.compression JSONB field, (5) Return value now includes compressed, storedSize, compressionRatio. Created comprehensive test file at packages/lib/src/__tests__/page-version-service.test.ts with mocked database. Committed as aa9c7f1.

phases.name: Database Schema Extension
phases.description: Extend pageVersions schema with retention policy and compression metadata fields

subtasks.description: Add retention policy helper to versioning schema

verification.instructions: Review schema changes - no migration needed as expiresAt field already exists and metadata is JSONB

subtasks.notes: Added retention policy configuration to versioning schema: (1) DEFAULT_VERSION_RETENTION_DAYS constant (30 days), (2) calculateVersionExpiresAt() helper function for computing expiration dates with default parameters, (3) VersionCompressionMetadata interface documenting compression tracking fields, (4) PageVersionMetadata and DriveBackupMetadata interfaces documenting JSONB metadata schemas. No migration needed as expiresAt field already exists. Committed as 0a1db3f.

phases.name: Diff Engine - Backend
phases.description: Implement server-side diff generation for comparing versions

verification.expected: Diff generation tests pass for HTML, text, JSON

subtasks.notes:
Created diff-utils.ts module at packages/lib/src/content/diff-utils.ts with comprehensive diffing capabilities:

Functions implemented:
- diffContent(oldContent, newContent, options): Main diff function supporting text, HTML, JSON, and tiptap formats. Returns DiffResult with changes array and statistics.
- generateUnifiedDiff(old, new, labels): Generates unified diff format (like git diff)
- applyDiff(baseContent, patchText): Applies patches to restore content
- summarizeDiff(diffResult): Human-readable change summary
- extractSections(content): Extracts sections for selective rollback support
- diffTiptapNodes(old, new): Node-level diffing for tiptap documents

Features:
- Auto-detection of content format using detectPageContentFormat
- Line mode option for efficient large text diffs
- Position tracking (originalStart/End, newStart/End)
- Statistics: additions, deletions, unchanged, totalChanges
- Configurable timeout for complex diffs
- prettyPrint option for JSON/tiptap

Uses diff-match-patch library (already installed in phase 1).

Test file created at packages/lib/src/__tests__/diff-utils.test.ts with 50+ test cases.

Exported from packages/lib/src/content/index.ts.

Committed as d8ecc118. Tests need to be run manually (cd packages/lib && pnpm test -- diff-utils.test.ts).

GET endpoint accepting v1 and v2 query params (version IDs). Fetch both versions, decompress content, generate diff using diffContent(), return structured diff. Server-side only for security/performance

phases.name: Rollback Enhancement - Backend
phases.description: Enhance rollback service to support embedded files and selective rollback

subtasks.description: Add embedded file validation to rollback service

verification.expected: Rollback tests pass including embedded file scenarios

subtasks.notes: Add validateEmbeddedFiles() function to check file references exist before rollback. Handle deleted files gracefully (warn user, skip or placeholder). Ensure file references remain valid post-rollback

Implement applySelectiveRollback(pageId, versionId, sections[]) to revert specific sections. Parse Tiptap JSON to extract node ranges. Merge selected nodes from old version into current content. Create new version with 'selective_rollback' source
POST endpoint accepting versionId and optional sections array. If sections provided, use selective rollback service. Otherwise, full rollback. Return new version ID

phases.name: Retention Policy Enforcement
phases.description: Implement 30-day version retention policy with cleanup

subtasks.description: Update version creation to set expiresAt

verification.expected: New versions have expiresAt set to 30 days

subtasks.notes: Modify createPageVersion() to automatically set expiresAt to 30 days from creation. Respect isPinned flag (pinned versions don't expire)
Implement cleanupExpiredVersions() to delete versions where expiresAt < now() AND isPinned = false. Also delete associated contentRef files from storage. Run as scheduled job or manual trigger

phases.name: Frontend - Diff UI Components
phases.description: Build UI components for version comparison and diff visualization

subtasks.notes: Create Next.js page component for version comparison. Accept v1 and v2 query params. Fetch diff from API endpoint. Use verified React diff viewer component. Support split and unified views
Create reusable component for version history sidebar/panel. Display list of versions with timestamp, user, compressed size. Add 'Compare' button to select two versions. Link to compare page
Create dialog component for selective rollback. Show diff with checkboxes for each section/paragraph. Preview what will be reverted. Confirm button calls rollback API with selected sections

phases.name: Integration & E2E Testing
phases.description: Verify end-to-end version comparison, rollback, and retention workflows

steps: Check additions shown in green, deletions in red

subtasks.notes: E2E test covering full version comparison flow from UI to API to storage

subtasks.description: Test selective rollback with embedded files

steps: Attempt selective rollback to version with image
Verify rollback handles deleted file gracefully

subtasks.notes: Critical edge case: rollback must handle deleted embedded files without breaking

steps: Read version and verify decompression works
Create version with expiresAt in past

subtasks.notes: Test compression, storage, decompression, and retention cleanup end-to-end

parallel_groups.reason: Both depend only on phase-1-package-verification, work on different files (lib storage vs db schema)
Can run in parallel with phase-4/5 as it only depends on phase-3 and works on different concerns

acceptance_criteria: No data loss in rollback operations
Visual diff renders correctly for all content formats
Embedded file rollback handles deleted files gracefully
verification_strategy.reasoning: High risk due to version control operations affecting data integrity. Requires comprehensive testing including E2E scenarios to verify rollback flows work correctly without data loss. Embedded file handling is critical edge case.

checks: Compression metadata exists in pageVersions.metadata JSONB
expiresAt set to 30 days from createdAt for new versions
contentRef points to compressed content in storage
Expired versions deleted by cleanup service
